name: Who Are These People, Anyway? Quiz | Common Bond | 15 Questions

questions.text: Who starred in the detective TV series 'Columbo'?
questions.explanation:
Peter Falk.

	He always reminded me of a basset hound...

questions.text: Who was known as the Man of a Thousand Voices?
questions.explanation:
Mel Blanc.

	He was the voice of, among others, Bugs Bunny and Daffy Duck.

questions.text: Which chess virtuoso beat Boris Spassky after 21 games to win the World Chess Championship in 1972?
questions.explanation:
Bobby Fischer.

	He had a volatile temperament, like many professional chess players.

questions.text: Which of these persons is someone who died in the explosion of the Space Shuttle Challenger?
questions.explanation:
Judith Resnik.

	She was a biological engineer from Ohio State University.

questions.text: What astronomer, author of 'Cosmos' is famous for his utterances about 'billions and billions of stars'?
questions.explanation:
Carl Sagan.

	With his early death, science lost a champion.

questions.text: Who wrote about multiple murderer Gary Gilmore in 'The Executioner's Song'?
questions.explanation:
Norman Mailer.

	This was a meticulous and heartrending book.

questions.text: Who wrote the famous play, turned into both a movie and a TV series, called 'The Odd Couple'?
questions.explanation:
Neil Simon.

	The saga of Oscar and Felix.

questions.text: This founder of non-Euclidean geometry is probably most famous for his satirization in a song by Tom Lehrer.
questions.explanation:
Nikolay Ivanovich Lobachevsky.

	' and Nikolay Ivanovich Lobachevsky is his name!'

questions.text: Who was a monetary consultant and policy advisor to the Nixon, Ford, Reagan and Bush administrations -- and continued under Clinton as chairman of the Federal Reserve Board?
questions.explanation:
Alan Greenspan.

	Greenspan had one of the longest careers in politics in the US.

questions.text: Who was the Brooklyn-born gangster who founded Las Vegas as a gambling mecca?
questions.explanation:
Bugsy Siegel.

	His given name was Benjamin Siegelbaum.

questions.text: Whose book of prophecies, written in the 1500's but still believed by many today, was the subject of a song by Al Stewart?
questions.explanation:
Nostradamus & Michel de Nostradame & Nostradame.

	He was also a doctor!

questions.text: What person, whose biography was written by Amy Wallace, is regarded by many as the brightest human ever born, claiming an IQ between 250-300?
questions.explanation:
William Sidis.

	Sidis was born in 1898. He spoke in sentences at 8 months, read the New York Times at 18 months, passed the MIT entrance exam at age 8, and graduated from Harvard at 16. He wrote many books and was a true eccentric.

questions.text: Who discovered the subatomic particle called a 'quark'?
questions.explanation:
Murray Gell-Mann.

	Quarks come in many flavors, such as "strange" and "top."

questions.text: What rock star's hits include 'Just the Way You Are', 'Big Shot' and 'An Innocent Man'?
questions.explanation:
Billy Joel & Joel.

	He is also known for his piano-playing.

questions.text: All of these people have one thing in common. They are all....
questions.explanation:
Jews & Jewish & Jew.

	Surprise! Quite a pool of talent, eh? If I do this again, I need to include more women...
